pageContext.claim: “Mailmen are being, as you know, indicted. One was indicted yesterday in New Jersey, another one was indicted in West Virginia.”
pageContext.analysis: A West Virginia postal carrier in July pleaded guilty to mail and election fraud after admitting he changed the political affiliation on five voter ballots from Democrat to Republican. The mail carrier said he did it “as a joke.” In New Jersey, a mail carrier threw out hundreds of pieces of mail, including blank ballots. The charges he faces are centered on his failure to deliver mail, not on fraud.
